result.execSummary:
The defendant Jasen R Suszek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight-Time.
Concurrent with: Any sentence currently being served.
Costs to be paid by 04-01-2023. Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

records.addlTxt:
4:07 PM Defendant Jasen R Suszek in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Jasen R Suszek. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Court conducts plea colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations. 
Defendant makes statement to the court. 

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

JAIL:  7 MONTHS - Straight-time.
Concurrent to any sentence currently being served; 
0  Days Credit.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid by 4/01/2023.  Alternate:  Entry of civil judgment.

11:13 AM Defendant Jasen R Suszek in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Jasen R Suszek. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 17, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

09:22 AM Defendant Jasen R Suszek in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
